verb.description: (of an animal) wound (a person or animal) by scratching and tearing.
examples: the herdsmen were mauled by lions

noun.description: A tool with a heavy head and a handle, used for tasks such as ramming, crushing, and driving wedges; a beetle.

origin: Middle English (in the sense hammer or wooden club, also strike with a heavy weapon): from Old French mail, from Latin malleus hammer.
